text: connection may not close in JDBCRealm when some exception happen. Take public synchronized Principal authenticate(String username, String credentials)  method for a example, if some exception (not SQLException) is been throw by the code , without finally code, the connection will never close. I think this is a issue.

Hi,

According to the JDBCRealm implementation, the db connection is kept opened and reused whenever it is needed.
It is like a simple connection pool with just one connection.
The connection is closed only when there is an SQLException in order to reopen a new connection and ensure its clean state.
I think that the connection should not be closed each time as the overall performance will be severely affected. 

Regards
Violeta Georgieva
